alert.note: Alert for Santa Fe; Torrance (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 4:25PM MDT until June 19 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Bernalillo and Torrance. In north central New Mexico, Santa Fe. * WHEN...Until 615 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving slowly northeast along the east slope of the Manzano Mountains toward Edgewood and Moriarty. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moriarty, Edgewood, Chilili, Escabosa, Tajique, Manzano, Manzano Mountain State Park, Torreon, Miera and Ponderosa Pines. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 185 and 205. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
